va-sq-108:
Kirsty Williams, the Cabinet Secretary for Education in Wales, discussed the trend of teacher recruiting in Wales during the meeting of the Children, Young People, and Education Committee. She mentioned that the trend is not unique to Wales and is a common issue across the globe. The reasons for the trend include a lack of attractiveness of teaching as a profession, financial incentives not being enough to encourage people to pursue teaching, and a shortage of employment-based routes into qualified teacher status.

To address the issue, Kirsty Williams mentioned that the Welsh government had set targets to increase the number of teachers trained in Welsh medium schools, and they were working closely with ITE centres to develop and agree upon minimum provision for Welsh language skills within ITE provision for all teachers. Additionally, they had introduced new financial incentives for people starting their course and for teachers who complete their QTS after a year.
